GapFillInput.Title: Obligation and permission in the present
GapFillInput.Instruction: Use the word in brackets to complete the second sentence so that it means the same as the first. Type your answers. Use short forms.

Content.Question:
1. The public isn’t allowed to enter. (can)
The public can't enter.
2. Ken should do more exercise. (ought to)
Ken ought to do more exercise.
3. It isn’t necessary for my son to wear a uniform. (have to)
My son doesn't have to wear a uniform.
4. You can take a small piece of hand luggage. (allowed to)
You 're allowed to take a small piece of hand luggage|are allowed to take a small piece of hand luggage.
5. It’s freezing in here. It would be a good idea to turn up the heating. (should)
It’s freezing in here. You should turn up the heating.
6. What is necessary for me to do next? (have to)
What do I have to do next?
7. Look at the time! I’ve got to go! (must)
Look at the time! I must go!
8. It’s not a good idea to shut your computer down at night. (should)
You shouldn't shut your computer down at night.
9. Tess can’t watch television after eight o'clock. (allowed to)
Tess isn't allowed to watch television after eight o'clock.
10. You aren’t allowed to smoke in here. (must)
You mustn't smoke in here.
